channel.title: Movies
channel.description:
I've been in a rut the past few days. I've seen almost every comedy movie above a 50% on rotten tomatoes. Now i've got nothing to do except watch my box-set season one of fringe. I need some good movies that i haven't seen yet. Anything under R would be appreciated as i hate NC-17 acting.
A list of some movies i've seen. The Big Lebowski Ferris Buller's Day off Matchstick Men Bandits Run Fatboy Run (anything with will ferall) Sean of the Dead Paul Hot Fuzz Kung Fu Panda Hangover (hangover two looked like it sucked so im not gonna watch that one) Role Models (By far a favorite) Old School knocked up Kick Ass Superbad How to Train Your Dragon The Jerk Spaceballs National Lampoon's Vacation Caddyshack Dinner for Schmucks Date Night Dan in Real Life Dr. Seuss' Horton Hears a Who! Get Smart Little Miss Sunshine Bruce Almighty Yes Man Lemony Snicket's A Series of Unfortunate Events Eternal Sunshine Of The Spotless Mind Me, Myself & Irene Fun With Dick and Jane Liar Liar Dumb and Dumber The Mask The Cable Guy
And much more than that xD anymore ideas?

item.title: Movies
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

Archie’s Final Project. Great movie, would recommend to anyone who actually appreciates good films.

item.title: Movies
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:13, topic:427267”][quote author=Fridder link=topic=529968.msg3868934#msg3868934 date=1325196810]
Unstoppable is a pretty good movie. Its about a train that has tons of flammable liquid on it and its going really fast and someone has to try to stop it, they can’t derail it because its going too fast and its too heavy. They have to stop it before it goes on a turn and blows up a city.
[/quote]

  1. Put a penny on the track.
  2. Make the train hop the tracks.
  3. ???
  4. Profit!!![/quote]Mythbusters did something about that haha

Read full topic

item.title: Movies
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“Unicron, post:17, topic:427267”][quote author=vManlyMan link=topic=529968.msg3870408#msg3870408 date=1325302700]

The happiest time of my life is when I watched McGruber. You should watch that.

Don’t watch if your afraid of throat ripping though.

oh i saw that movie, it was aweful. i hated every second of it.

You have a dull sense of humor.
[/quote]
i watch familyguy 24/7 what are you talking about?[/quote]

Read full topic

item.description:
@kickingjamie wrote:

You should watch hangover 2, I actually thought it was better then the first one…

Any of the transformers films. Any of the fast and furious films. Paul blart maul cop is pretty good.

I could go on for ages with good movies not on that list.

item.description:
@RsInFecTion wrote:

[quote=“vManlyMan, post:10, topic:427267”][quote author=RsInFecTion link=topic=529968.msg3868912#msg3868912 date=1325195544]

I just watched ‘Salt’ yesterday. It’s not a comedy, but it’s really good.

I did not really enjoy the movie, it was to predicable. Ideas have been used before.
[/quote]

I didnt think so.

Plus Angelina Jolie is hawt.[/quote]

Everyone has their own opinions :D. Yeah she was probably only reason I watched. when she was in her bra in the beginning I was hard as fuck. lool.

item.title: Movies
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

Watch Requiem for a Dream. It isn’t a comedy, and you might feel bad for a week or so afterwards. It’s a fantastic movie though. It uses extreme worse case scenarios to scare people away from drugs, they should show it in schools in my opinion.

Read full topic

I’ve been in a rut the past few days. I’ve seen almost every comedy movie above a 50% on rotten tomatoes. Now i’ve got nothing to do except watch my box-set season one of fringe. I need some good movies that i haven’t seen yet. Anything under R would be appreciated as i hate NC-17 acting.

The Big Lebowski
